# oldr: An Implementation of the Rapid Assessment Method for Older People (RAM-OP)

[HelpAge International](https://www.helpage.org), [VALID
International](http://www.validinternational.org), and [Brixton
Health](http://www.brixtonhealth.com), with financial assistance from
the [Humanitarian Innovation Fund
(HIF)](https://www.elrha.org/innovation), have developed a **Rapid
Assessment Method for Older People (RAM-OP)** that provides accurate and
reliable estimates of the needs of older people. The method uses simple
procedures, in a short time frame (i.e. about two weeks including
training, data collection, data entry, and data analysis), and at
considerably lower cost than other methods. The **RAM-OP** method is
based on the following principles:

- Use of a familiar *“household survey”* design employing a two-stage
  cluster sample design optimised to allow the use of a small primary
  sample (*m ≥ 16 clusters*) and a small overall (*n ≥ 192*) sample.

- Assessment of multiple dimensions of need in older people (including
  prevalence of global, moderate and severe acute malnutrition) using,
  whenever possible, standard and well-tested indicators and question
  sets.

- Data analysis performed using modern computer-intensive methods to
  allow estimates of indicator levels to be made with useful precision
  using a small sample size.

## Installation

You can install [oldr](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/) from
[CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("oldr")
```

## Usage

This package contains functions that support in the data processing,
analysis, and visualisation of RAM-OP survey datasets collected using
the standard RAM-OP survey questionnaire.

The figure below illustrates the RAM-OP workflow and indicates which
functions in the [oldr](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/) package support
which particular step in the process.

![RAM-OP workflow](reference/figures/ramOPworkflow.png)

For a more detailed description of the RAM-OP survey, read the [RAM-OP
manual](https://rapidsurveys.io/ramOPmanual/).

## Citation

If you use the [oldr](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/) package in your
work, please cite using the suggested citation provided by a call to the
`citation` function as follows:

``` r
citation("oldr")
#> To cite oldr in publications use:
#> 
#>   Mark Myatt, Ernest Guevarra, Pascale Fritsch, Katja Siling (2026).
#>   _oldr: An Implementation of Rapid Assessment Method for Older
#>   People_. doi:10.5281/zenodo.7505731
#>   <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7505731>, R package version 0.2.4,
#>   <https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/>.
#> 
#> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is
#> 
#>   @Manual{,
#>     title = {oldr: An Implementation of Rapid Assessment Method for Older People},
#>     author = {{Mark Myatt} and {Ernest Guevarra} and {Pascale Fritsch} and {Katja Siling}},
#>     year = {2026},
#>     note = {R package version 0.2.4},
#>     url = {https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/},
#>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.7505731},
#>   }
```

## Community guidelines

Feedback, bug reports, and feature requests are welcome; file issues or
seek support [here](https://github.com/rapidsurveys/oldr/issues). If you
would like to contribute to the package, please see our [contributing
guidelines](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/CONTRIBUTING.html).

This project is released with a [Contributor Code of
Conduct](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html). By
contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.

# Package index

## Create indicators

- [`create_op()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_demo()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_food()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_hunger()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_adl()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_disability()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_mental()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_dementia()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_health()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_income()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_wash()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_anthro()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_oedema()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_screening()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_visual()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  [`create_op_misc()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/create_op.md)
  : Create older people indicators dataset from survey data collected
  using the standard RAM-OP questionnaire.

## Estimate indicators

- [`estimate_classic()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/estimate_classic.md)
  : Apply bootstrap to RAM-OP indicators using a classical estimator.
- [`estimate_op()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/estimate_op.md)
  : Estimate all standard RAM-OP indicators
- [`estimate_probit()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/estimate_probit.md)
  : Apply bootstrap to RAM-OP indicators using a PROBIT estimator.

## Create charts

- [`chart_op_age()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_muac()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_mf()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_dds()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_k6()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_adl()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_wash()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_csid()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_wg()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_hhs()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  [`chart_op_income()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/chart_op.md)
  : Plot RAM-OP indicators
- [`pyramid_plot()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/pyramid_plot.md)
  : Function to create a pyramid plot

## Create report

- [`report_op_html()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op_html.md)
  : Create an HTML report document containing RAM-OP survey results
- [`report_op_docx()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op_docx.md)
  : Create a DOCX report document containing RAM-OP survey results
- [`report_op_odt()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op_odt.md)
  : Create a ODT report document containing RAM-OP survey results
- [`report_op_pdf()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op_pdf.md)
  : Create a PDF report document containing RAM-OP survey results
- [`report_op_table()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_demo()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_food()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_hunger()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_disability()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_adl()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_mental()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_dementia()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_health()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_oedema()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_anthro()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_screen()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_visual()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_income()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_wash()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  [`report_op_misc()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/report_op.md)
  : Create table and report chunk of RAM-OP results

## Utility/support functions

- [`probit_gam()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/op_probit.md)
  [`probit_sam()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/op_probit.md)
  : PROBIT statistics function for bootstrap estimation of older people
  GAM
- [`merge_op()`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/merge_op.md) :
  Concatenate classic and PROBIT estimates into a single data.frame

## Datasets

- [`testSVY`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/testSVY.md) :
  RAM-OP Survey Dataset
- [`testPSU`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/testPSU.md) :
  RAM-OP Population Dataset
- [`indicators.ALL`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/indicators.ALL.md)
  : RAM-OP Indicators Dataset - ALL
- [`indicators.MALES`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/indicators.MALES.md)
  : RAM-OP Indicators Dataset - MALES
- [`indicators.FEMALES`](https://rapidsurveys.io/oldr/reference/indicators.FEMALES.md)
  : RAM-OP Indicators Dataset - FEMALES
